Saudi Arabia

Group A | Asia

Al Kabsa

Considered the benchmark team in the Middle East, the Saudis, nicknamed The Falcons, sure have an eye for a good meal.

Mixing sweet and savory, chicken & rice has never had such range. Taken from Martha Stewart this Saudi national dish is popular in many countries in the region, and just might qualify as one of yours too.

  • Time 1hr 40mins
  • Makes 4
  • Difficulty Professional
  • Units Imperial Metric

Ingredients

  • 250 g Plain yogurt
    1 cup
    250 g
    Plain yogurt
  • 2 tbsp Parsley
    2 tbsp
    2 tbsp
    Parsley finely chopped
  • a pinch Cayenne pepper
    a pinch
    a pinch
    Cayenne pepper
  • 1 Lemon
    1
    1
    Lemon
  • 4 Chicken thighs
    4
    4
    Chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp Olive oil
    1 tbsp
    1 tbsp
    Olive oil
  • 1 Onion
    1
    1
    Onion diced
  • 2 Cloves of garlic
    2
    2
    Cloves of garlic minced
  • 1 Carrot
    1
    1
    Carrot shredded
  • 1 tsp Cumin
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    Cumin
  • 1 tsp Ground coriander
    1 tsp
    1 tsp
    Ground coriander
  • &frac12; tsp Tumeric
    ½ tsp
    ½ tsp
    Tumeric
  • 2 Tomatoes
    2
    2
    Tomatoes roughly chopped
  • 2 tbsp Tomato paste
    2 tbsp
    2 tbsp
    Tomato paste
  • 600ml Chicken stock
    2 ½ cups
    600ml
    Chicken stock
  • 4 Caradmom pods
    4
    4
    Caradmom pods crushed
  • 2 Whole cloves
    2
    2
    Whole cloves cloves
  • 2 Cinnamon sticks
    2
    2
    Cinnamon sticks
  • 2 Bay leaves
    2
    2
    Bay leaves
  • 1 Orange
    1
    1
    Orange
  • 200g Rice
    1 ½ cups
    200g
    Rice
  • 450ml Safflower oil
    2 cups
    450ml
    Safflower oil
  • 60g Almonds
    ½ cup
    60g
    Almonds
  • 60g Raisins
    ½ cup
    60g
    Raisins
  • 1
    Start by making the lemon yogurt sauce. Mix the yogurt, parsley, and cayenne along with the juice and zest of the lemon.
  • 2
    Preheat the oven to 375°F200°C. Meanwhile season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper. On a high setting, heat the olive oil in a pan and seal the chicken on all sides. Remove when done.
  • 3
    In the same pan, add the onion, garlic, carrot, cumin, coriander and tumeric. Cook for around 5 minutes.
  • 4
    Stir in the tomatoes, tomato paste, chicken stock, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and bay-leaves along with the zest and juice of the orange. Season with salth and pepper and add the chicken and transfer the pot to the oven for 25 minutes.
  • 5
    Remove the pot from the oven and move the chicken to a lined baking sheet. Reduce the oven to 275°F135°C and place the chicken back in the oven.
  • 6
    Return the pan with the cooking liquid in it to the stove and bring to a simmer. Add the rice, cover and continue to simmer for 20 minutes
    Coach's tip Keep an eye on the cardomom pods, as you may want to remove them before serving.
    Coach's tip Keep an eye on the cardomom pods, as you may want to remove them before serving.
  • 7
    Meanwhile bring the safflower oil to a medium heat in a small pan. Add the almonds and cook until golden brown, roughly 5 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and leave to dry on paper towels.
  • 8
    In the same oil, fry the raisins. They will cook quickly, remove from oil when they puff up and begin to brown. Remove the chicken from the oven, serve over rice and top with raisins, almonds and the yogurt sauce.
